fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.es.models

Class AtomicES_Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.es.models.AtomicES_Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, AtomicModelI, EventsExchangingI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BankModel, ClientGeneratorModel, NetworkModel, ServerModel, Tic_ES_Model, WiFiDisconnectionModel

    public abstract class AtomicES_Model
extends AtomicModel
    The class AtomicES_Model implements the behaviours of atomic model in event scheduling simulation models.

    Description

    ES stands for Event Scheduling (ES) world view, a type of discrete event simulation where the progress of the simulation revolves around event processing, which causes modifications to the state and the scheduling of new events.

    When casting ES simulations into a DEVS simulation framework, an event list is added to the state to record the events that are scheduled to be simulated in the future (in simulation time). The time advance function hence simply returns the time to go until the next event in the event list. Internal transitions removes the next event from the event list, computes the next state given this event, produces the future events and schedule them into the event list of the new state. External transitions execute events received from other models on the atomic model.

    Hence, most of the processing done in state implementation:

    • the event list contains the list of events to be processed ordered by the simulation time of their occurrence and their priority if their time of occurrence is the same;
    • the time advance function returns the delay until the next event occurrence in simulation time;
    • the output function retrieves from the event list the exported events to be processed and returns them so that they will be propagated to their destination models;
    • the internal transition function calls its processNextEvents method which first retrieves the set of events that must be executed at the current time from the event list then for each event in turn it calls the method executeOn on the event to perform the state modifications and then its generateAndScheduleNewEvents to add the new events generated by the current one to the event list of the model;
    • the external transition function is assumed to be called at the time of occurrence of the external event that is processed immediately by calling its executeOn method to perform the state modifications and then its generateAndScheduleNewEvents method to get the new events generated by the received one and schedule them into the event list.

    The implementation provided here follows the spirit of the description appearing in:

    • H. Vangheluwe, Discrete Event Modelling and Simulation, courseware, 2001.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       EVENT_QUEUE_INITIAL_CAPACITY > 0
 invariant       eventList != null

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2018-07-11

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      protected static int EVENT_QUEUE_INITIAL_CAPACITY
      initial number of events that can be stored in the event queue; grows as needed after.
      protected java.util.PriorityQueue<ES_EventI> eventList
      queue of events to be executed by the model; events are scheduled to be executed at some time of occurrence in simulated time, hence the queue is sorted in ascending order of times of occurrence.

      create an atomic event scheduling model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

      for event scheduling models, first extract all imported events from the currently stored received events and add them to the event list so that they will be sorted by their order of execution, then the user defined external transition method is called to process the remaining events and possibly the imported events if the model wishes to do so manually.

      initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.
      void internalTransition()
      for event scheduling models, first call userDefinedInternalTransition to execute the user-defined model behaviour (which can manually extract some of the current ES events from the event list) and then extract the remaining ES events which time of occurrence is equal to the current state time and execute them in their order of appearance in the event list.

      do a confluent transition i.e., processing internal and external transitions occurring at the same simulation time using previously stored external input events; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models.
      void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      verify that all events remaining in the currently stored events are not ES events; hence the user can find in the current stored events non ES imported events and in the event list the ES imported ones.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AtomicES_Model

        public AtomicES_Model(java.lang.String uri,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                      AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        create an atomic event scheduling model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.

        Description

        The standard predefined state initialisation will set the time to the next event. Hence, if a specific model has to perform some initialisations which the first internal transition depends upon, it must first perform them and then call the inherited method using super.

        Contract

         pre     initialTime != null
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    isInitialised()
        Specified by:
        initialiseState in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        initialiseState in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        initialTime - time of the simulation when it will start.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.initialiseState(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

 post    true        // no postcondition.

      • internalTransition

        public void internalTransition()
        for event scheduling models, first call userDefinedInternalTransition to execute the user-defined model behaviour (which can manually extract some of the current ES events from the event list) and then extract the remaining ES events which time of occurrence is equal to the current state time and execute them in their order of appearance in the event list.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no more preconditions.
 post    true        // no more postconditions.
        Specified by:
        internalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        internalTransition in class AtomicModel
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.internalTransition()

      • externalTransition

        public void externalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        for event scheduling models, first extract all imported events from the currently stored received events and add them to the event list so that they will be sorted by their order of execution, then the user defined external transition method is called to process the remaining events and possibly the imported events if the model wishes to do so manually. Imported events not manually processed by the user defined external transition method will remain in the event list and they will be executed as internal events by the event scheduling mechanism.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no more preconditions.
 post    true        // no more postconditions.
        Specified by:
        externalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        externalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - elapsed time since the last transition.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.externalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • userDefinedExternalTransition

        public void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        verify that all events remaining in the currently stored events are not ES events; hence the user can find in the current stored events non ES imported events and in the event list the ES imported ones.

        Contract

         pre     assertOnCurrentStoredEvents(e -> !(e instanceof ES_EventI))
 post    true        // no more postconditions.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - simulation time since the last processed event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedExternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

        protected void scheduleEvent(ES_EventI event)

 post    isScheduled(event)
 post    getNumberOfScheduledEvents() == getNumberOfScheduledEvents()at_pre + 1

 pre     events.size() > 0 && areScheduled(events)
